doc.previous: The Kolkata metropolitan area is spread over 1,886.67Â km2 (728.45Â sqÂ mi)[55]:7 and comprises 3Â municipal corporations (including Kolkata Municipal Corporation), 39Â local municipalities and 24Â panchayat samitis, as of 2011[update].[55]:7 The urban agglomeration encompassed 72Â cities and 527Â towns and villages, as of 2006[update].[56] Suburban areas in the Kolkata metropolitan area incorporate parts of the following districts: North 24 Parganas, South 24 Parganas, Howrah, Hooghly, and Nadia.[57]:15 Kolkata, which is under the jurisdiction of the Kolkata Municipal Corporation ( KMC), has an area of 185Â km2 (71Â sqÂ mi).[56] The eastâwest dimension of the city is comparatively narrow, stretching from the Hooghly River in the west to roughly the Eastern Metropolitan Bypass in the eastâa span of 9â10Â km (5.6â6.2Â mi).[58] The northâsouth distance is greater, and its axis is used to section the city into North, Central, and South Kolkata.
